history.text: Hi, there!
Hey!
Have you seed The Social Network, that movie about the founding of FAcebook?
I haven't, but I'm interested in doing so
It got a really good Rotton Tomato rating - 96%
I really don't understand how Facebook came to be, but it seems like a complex story
That's impressive
It's based on a book called "The ACcidental Billionaires: The Founding of Facebook...," but none of the Facebook people were involved.
That seems a bit odd
How did they get the information they needed if n one from Facebook was involved?

Usually is.........    Info came from the book, and o
ne of the Facebook founders was a consultant on the book, though.
Have you seen it? Would you recommend it?
No, I haven't seen it either, but I've heard some about it. Apparently Zuckerberg was dumped by his girlfriend and it all started there. Cherche le femme, as the French say!!
Did Zuckerberg like or approve of the film?
It must suck to have a movie made about you that starts with you getting dumped.

He had a live journal blog on which he insulted her, and then set up a campus website to steal pics of girls so people can rate their attractiveness. Don't know of Zuckerberg's like/interest, but he sounds a bit of a creep based on this.
Woah. That's not good at all
I don't really like it either.
The popularity of the face rating thing got the attention of some upperclassmen who got him involved in a dating app
They should've gotten him involved with a therapist
Or maybe the cops
You shouldn't post pictures of people without their permission

Yeah. I agree. They got permission from at least one person: 
Apparently a female student asked to be on their thing by saying "Facebook me," which appears to be where he got the idea from.
I hope he paid her for the name brand
Does the movie paint him in a good light?

I doubt it. People with money get it by keeping the flow as one way as possible, if you know what I mean. Anyway, everyone's cheering their heads off over the popularity so it's expanded to Yale, Columbia, and Stanford.
The popularity of the original app or of facebook?
FaceBook. Sorry. Then they meet the Napster guy and move to Palo Alto -- the Napster guy promised to expand to two continents.
When was this?
What year?

Not sure of the timeline, but teh original nasty business (dumping/insulting/stealing pics) was 2003. The interesting thing in teh movie is they intercut in the film with scenes from depositions taken in the subsequent lawsuits. Two of the folks involved in early stages said Z stole their idea.
That's not super great, I wonder why he let that happen
Seems like he has enough money to stop it
Or to make the movie the way he wanted it
Ultimately there was a settlement because of the sordid beginnings that would make Z look unsympathetic.
Makes sense, I guess
Anything else you found interesting about it?
I'll say! It ends with him trying to get a friend request response from the girlfriend who dumped him originally, but he doesn't appear to get a response.
Good.
I agree!!!

uid1response.feedback: Note that in the 3d add'l paragraph, the ending appears to be from the movie Superhuman, not the subject film (re Faceobok).

uid2response.feedback: I don't usually go for non-fiction movies, but the other user was well-informed.
